intro: Brachyglottis turneri, commonly known as the Kākāriki or the New Zealand flax, is a member of the Compositae family and is native to New Zealand. It is a flowering plant characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant has finely divided, feather-like leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Brachyglottis turneri plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various native wildlife.
